body:
> it lets actions keep state in memory between stages of execution (maybe that isn't a good thing though?).

That was why I didn't, but I'm starting to doubt that. Now that I think about it, moving the persistence to the storage object instead of, say, persisting stuff in the sandbox, doesn't actually strongly prevent actions from messing with eachother, and maybe the likelihood of one recipe accidentally breaking things for other recipes isn't as high as I thought.

The error handling improvements are pretty compelling. I'd love for `run` to be simpler.

I'll ponder it over lunch and figure out if I want to update the PR.
